intro: Rhynchospora grayi, commonly known as gray's spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant has slender, triangular stems that are often densely covered with short, stiff hairs. Its inflorescence consists of a single, compact spike of small, three-lobed flowers, typically greenish or reddish in color. Rhynchospora grayi is adapted to moist or aquatic environments and plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils.
